AT.callerid_rules: Caller ID must not be concealed (per telecom rules; no special prefix mandated).
AT.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent (opt-in):.
AT.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is also restricted; explicit consent or clear prior indication of interest is required:.
AT.notes_for_product: No DNC list for calls (only email list). Platform should obtain express consent before calling any Austrian consumer or business. Treat all cold calls as opt-in only.

BE.callerid_rules: Caller ID must be visible (anonymous calls are prohibited by Code of Economic Law). No special prefix.
BE.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed only if the person has not objected or registered on the national Do Not Call list::.
BE.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is similarly permitted unless the number is on the Do Not Call Me list (covers B2B and B2C):.
BE.notes_for_product: Platform must integrate DNCM scrubbing for all Belgian numbers (including corporate). Apply consumer quiet hours as best practice.

dnc.name: Do Not Call Me List (Liste Ne m’appelez plus)

sources.title: Code of Economic Law, Art. XII.13

BG.callerid_rules: Caller identity must not be concealed (per Electronic Communications Act).
BG.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is prohibited without prior consent: (opt-in required).
BG.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses: presumed consent model (allowed unless objected).
BG.notes_for_product: Treat all consumer calls as requiring explicit consent. No official DNC to check, but maintain internal opt-out list diligently. Be cautious with any unsolicited calls.

HR.callerid_rules: Caller ID must be visible; no special prefix required.
HR.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to consumers are allowed only if the person has not opted out (either directly or via the national ‘Do Not Call’ registry):
HR.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is generally permitted unless the business number is registered on the opt-out list
HR.notes_for_product: Must scrub calling lists against Croatia’s ‘Ne zovi’ registry. If unsure whether a number might be residential

CZ.callerid_rules: If a subscriber listed their number publicly and did not opt out there
CZ.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent unless the consumer has explicitly indicated in a public directory that they welcome marketing calls:
CZ.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses also generally requires consent

dnc.name: opt-in (unless public opt-in noted)
dnc.url: None (consent managed via public phone directory preferences)

DK.callerid_rules: Denmark bans unsolicited consumer calls for most products except a few sectors (e.g. insurance
DK.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is permitted only if the consumer has not opted out via the CPR “Robinson list” (opt-out):. Certain sectors may require prior consent by law
DK.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is allowed (no specific B2B restrictions)

EE.callerid_rules: Caller must provide identity; no special number prefix required.
EE.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed unless the person has opted out of such calls (opt-out; no national list):
EE.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to legal persons is allowed; generic business contacts can be used unless the entity opted out
EE.notes_for_product: Ensure any Estonian contact who says “do not call” is suppressed going forward (internal opt-out list). No centralized list to check

FI.callerid_rules: No broad exemption. Even existing customers should not be called for new offers without consent (unless falling under “closely related to job role” in B2B context).
FI.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is effectively opt-in – direct marketing calls are generally not allowed unless the consumer has given consent

dnc.name: opt-out for B2B
dnc.url: Direct Marketing Prohibition List (ASML/Robinson list for consumers)

FR.callerid_rules: Caller ID cannot be withheld. Use of mobile (06/07) or regular geographic numbers for mass outbound campaigns is prohibited for autodialers; call centers should use specific ranges (e.g. 01 62…
FR.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is heavily regulated: consumers must not be called if they are on the Bloctel opt-out list, and calls are only allowed within strict hours Mon–Fri:. In practice, prior consent is effectively required for unsolicited consumer calls (opt-out by law, but with severe constraints).
FR.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to business numbers is permitted, but the called party must have had an opportunity to object to such calls when their number was collected:. Strong identification requirements apply for call centers.
FR.notes_for_product: Art. L.223-1 Consumer Code (Bloctel):; Décret 2022-1313 (call hours)::; ARCEP Plan de Numérotation 2023:

DE.callerid_rules: Market research calls (if genuinely not sales-related) may not fall under UWG §7’s marketing call ban. However
DE.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to consumers are illegal without explicit prior consent:. German law treats unsolicited calls as an aggressive practice unless the consumer has actively agreed (opt-in)
DE.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is only allowed if the individual called can be presumed to have an interest and to have implicitly consented (“presumed consent”):. Otherwise, explicit consent is required even for B2B.

sources.title: No major legislative changes since 2021. Enforcement remains strict
high-profile fines have been issued for unlawful calls. Draft laws propose even tighter controls on spoofed calls.

GR.callerid_rules: it applies even to companies they have a relationship with.
GR.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed except where the consumer has opted out. Consumers can register objections (e.g. via their telecom provider) to avoid marketing calls (opt-out system):
GR.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is generally allowed; no specific B2B telemarketing provisions were found

dnc.name: No official national DNC (opt-outs handled via operators)

HU.confidence: no significant changes recently. electronic communications act and advertising act provisions still apply
HU.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to consumers are allowed unless the consumer has explicitly opted out beforehand (no national list; opt-out handled case-by-case):
HU.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses faces no specific prohibition

IE.callerid_rules: Limited. Irish law allows a form of “previous business context” for email/SMS
IE.confidence: but such entities can register on ndd to opt out
IE.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent unless a “soft opt-in” applies (existing customer with similar product):. Live marketing calls to mobile numbers are generally prohibited without explicit consent:. All cold calls must be screened against the National Do-Not-Call list.
IE.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to corporate entities is permitted without prior consent
IE.notes_for_product: but number used should permit a return call or identification.

sources.title: Caller ID must not be withheld (PECR requirement). No special prefix mandated

IT.callerid_rules: No automatic exemption. Being a customer does not exempt a company from checking RPO:. (Companies can call recent customers for similar products under soft opt-in for email/SMS, but for calls they must still honor RPO listings.)
IT.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is regulated on an opt-out basis via the Registro Pubblico delle Opposizioni (RPO):. Telemarketers may call consumers only if they are not listed in RPO and have not otherwise objected. Specific calling hours must be respected per the industry code
IT.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to business numbers is also covered by the RPO opt-out scheme (companies can register their lines):. Marketing calls to businesses are allowed unless the number is on RPO or the business objected
IT.notes_for_product: 2024) imposes stricter rules on call times

sources.title: RPO was expanded to cover mobile numbers and businesses. A new Telemarketing Code of Conduct (effective Sept 28

LV.callerid_rules: Direct marketing rules apply only to natural persons. Calls to a number owned by a company are not considered “consumer” calls:. Individuals have the right to object at any time to further calls.
LV.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing is generally allowed if the call is made to a number that belongs to a legal entity or was made public by the individual; purely private numbers are protected (opt-out by default)
LV.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to companies (legal entities) is allowed unless the company/employee has previously opted out. Calls to publicly listed business contacts are generally permissible:
LV.notes_for_product: Information Society Services Law §9:; DPA guidance (LV)

LT.callerid_rules: “Soft opt-in” exception exists for electronic channels in context of similar products
LT.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is only allowed with prior consent (opt-in):. Unsolicited calls to individuals without consent are prohibited
LT.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to business contacts also requires consent unless an exception for existing relationships applies:. Lithuania does not differentiate strongly between consumer and business targets for calls

LU.callerid_rules: If an individual gave prior consent or their number is public in a directory without opting out
LU.confidence: no significant changes. electronic privacy act still governs (only natural persons’ communications require consent)
LU.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent (natural persons are protected under the Electronic Privacy Act):. Unsolicited calls to individuals are not allowed unless opted in
LU.regime_b2b_text: No specific law for B2B calls: – marketing to corporate entities is generally allowed without consent. Only calls to natural persons (consumers) require opt-in by law

MT.callerid_rules: an existing customer can be called
MT.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed as long as the consumer has been given a clear chance to opt out of future calls. Essentially an opt-out regime – the first call is allowed

NL.confidence: 2021 amendment to article 11.7 of the telecommunications act introduced the consumer opt-in requirement and ended the opt-out registry
NL.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers now requires prior consent. As of 2021, cold calls to consumers are prohibited unless the consumer has explicitly opted in, or if there is a recent existing customer relationship (within 3 years) for similar products/services.
NL.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to companies (corporate subscribers) remains allowed without prior consent. However

PL.callerid_rules: explicit opt-in is strictly required for telemarketing. Enforcement by UKE is active.
PL.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to consumers require prior consent by law (opt-in). Poland’s law (Telecommunications Act Art. 172) prohibits calling or sending marketing communications without the subscriber’s prior consent
PL.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to companies/entrepreneurs also generally requires consent unless perhaps calling a generic office line without personal data. Polish law does not explicitly exempt B2B calls from the consent requirement.

PT.callerid_rules: if they registered on the opt-out list or otherwise objected
PT.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed unless the consumer has opted out. Portugal maintains an official opt-out list for consumers (and even legal persons) – marketers must not call numbers on this list:
PT.regime_b2b_text: No specific distinction; legal persons can also register on the opt-out list:. Generally

dnc.name: opt-out
dnc.url: Lista Nacional de Não Receção de Comunicações (Consumer General Directorate’s opt-out list)

RO.callerid_rules: legitimate_interest (one-party recording legal; must inform under GDPR)
RO.regime_b2c_text: There is no specific statute explicitly addressing live telemarketing calls to consumers. Unsolicited automated calls are explicitly forbidden without consent, but live calls fall under general data protection and fair practice rules. Marketers should obtain consent or at minimum honor any objections.
RO.regime_b2b_text: but implied by GDPR objection rights)
RO.notes_for_product: No recent legislative change. Enforcement largely through GDPR (ANSPDCP can sanction misuse of personal data in marketing).

dnc.name: no special B2B telemarketing law. Calls to companies are generally allowed
dnc.url: but any personal data use (calling a person) must respect objection rights

SK.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers requires prior consent, unless the number is publicly available and not opted out. Slovakia operates an opt-out list; if a consumer is not on that list and has publicly provided their number, calls may be made (opt-in by default, with opt-out signals considered):.
SK.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is allowed. However
SK.notes_for_product: marketers may call without separate consent:. Purely informational calls or those by certain regulated industries might not count as “marketing”.

sources.title: If a person publicly shares their contact (e.g. as solo entrepreneur) without opting out

SI.callerid_rules: The law explicitly requires consent for automated calling and fax marketing:. By omission
SI.regime_b2c_text: There are no specific rules prohibiting live person-to-person telemarketing calls to consumers in Slovenia. Unsolicited calls with a human operator are generally allowed (opt-out regime de facto). However, the use of automated calling machines or recorded messages is strictly forbidden without prior consent:.
SI.regime_b2b_text: No special legislation for B2B telemarketing; such calls are allowed unless objected to

ES.callerid_rules: if the consumer is on Lista Robinson (or has objected)
ES.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to consumers are allowed unless the person has opted out, for example through the Robinson List (Spain’s DNC list). Marketers must not call individuals who have registered their objection::.
ES.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to business contacts is generally allowed. Employees can also register their personal or work numbers on the Robinson list to opt out of marketing:
ES.notes_for_product: but currently no dedicated prefix is mandated aside from not misusing certain number ranges.

sources.title: Caller ID must be presented. Spain considered special prefixes (in 2020 a proposal for telemarketing prefix ‘+34 902’ or similar)

SE.callerid_rules: but DPA recommends informing; consent if recording for secondary uses)
SE.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed unless the consumer has registered their number on the NIX register (opt-out)::. Telemarketers must not call NIX-listed individuals without explicit consent. Sweden thus follows an opt-out regime enforced by self-regulation.
SE.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is permitted. If the call is clearly in connection to the recipient’s professional role or a company contact

sources.title: NIX opt-out does not cover calls for market research

CH.callerid_rules: Not specified (common practice: business hours on weekdays)
CH.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing to consumers is allowed unless the consumer has indicated their number is not to receive marketing calls. In practice, Swiss consumers can add an asterisk (*) in phone directories to opt out of sales calls:. Telemarketers are legally obliged to check directory listings and avoid calling *-marked numbers (opt-out system).
CH.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to businesses is allowed. The * opt-out system primarily applies to private individuals’ numbers. Companies’ main lines can be called
CH.notes_for_product: If the consumer has expressly consented to marketing calls

dnc.name: opt-out
dnc.url: Phone Directory Asterisk (""*"" marker in directories)

sources.title: but not for new marketing if the customer opted out.

GB.callerid_rules: Calls made purely for market research (no selling) are not covered by PECR’s marketing rules. Also
GB.regime_b2c_text: Telemarketing calls to individuals (consumers, sole traders, some partnerships) are allowed only if the person has not opted out. The Telephone Preference Service (TPS) is the official opt-out list – it is illegal to call any residential number on TPS without specific consent::.
GB.regime_b2b_text: Telemarketing to companies (corporate bodies) is allowed unless the number is registered on the Corporate TPS (CTPS)::. B2B calls to corporate entities do not require prior consent, but must cease if the organization opts out via CTPS or directly.

sources.title: enforcement has increased. In 2023–2024 the ICO issued large fines for firms ignoring TPS::. The UK government announced plans (2023) to outlaw cold calls for financial products

AE.callerid_rules: Display company identity; no personal numbers; no spoofing.
AE.recent_changes: New telemarketing regime in force 2024-08-27 (call window, frequency limits, DNCR).
AE.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
AE.notes_for_product: Enforce 09:00–18:00; block DNCR; ask continuation before pitch; show CallerID with company name; treat B2B numbers conservatively if they may belong to individuals.

SA.callerid_rules: CLI must be truthful; anti-spoofing enforced.
SA.recent_changes: CST Anti-Spam Regulations updated and consolidated (calls & messages) – ongoing enforcement.
SA.regime_b2c_text: Unsolicited calls/messages regulated by CST Anti-Spam framework
SA.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
SA.notes_for_product: Do not use auto-dialed/recorded voice without prior consent; maintain clear opt-out; display valid CallerID.

QA.recent_changes: CRA Anti-Spam/Unsolicited Communications regulation remains in force.
QA.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
QA.notes_for_product: Treat all outbound as consent-based unless documented opt-in; provide opt-out; avoid automated voice without opt-in.

KW.regime_b2c_text: Consumer rights restrict unsolicited electronic messages (SMS/email); calls not specifically regulated
KW.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
KW.notes_for_product: Avoid robocalls; treat live telemarketing as opt-out with clear stop mechanism; keep recordings off unless consent captured.

BH.callerid_rules: True CLI; anti-spoofing enforced via licensees.
BH.recent_changes: No formal DNC; TRA consumer guidance ongoing.
BH.regime_b2c_text: TRA spam rules focus on unsolicited electronic messages; limited specifics on live calls
BH.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
BH.notes_for_product: Prefer consent; provide opt-out; avoid automated voice without prior consent; display caller identity.

OM.regime_b2c_text: Consumer protection & TRA complaint regime; no explicit telemarketing code
OM.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
OM.notes_for_product: Use consent where feasible; provide opt-out; avoid robocalls.

JO.regime_b2c_text: TRC guidance on nuisance calls/SMS; no telemarketing-specific law
JO.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
JO.notes_for_product: Treat as opt-out with immediate stop; avoid automated voice; keep records.

LB.regime_b2c_text: General consumer/data-protection principles; no specific telemarketing statute
LB.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
LB.notes_for_product: Apply conservative approach: consent where possible; clear opt-out; avoid robocalls.

EG.callerid_rules: Must display entity name or NTRA Alert; enforcement ongoing.
EG.recent_changes: NTRA regulations announced 2024-07-21; enforcement actions 2024-10 and 2025.
EG.regime_b2c_text: NTRA regulates promotional/commercial calls (registration & caller identification)
EG.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
EG.notes_for_product: Only use registered lines; ensure name display or NTRA Alert; avoid spoofing; capture consent if recording.

dnc.name: None (registry of calling numbers, not DNC)

MA.regime_b2c_text: General consumer (Law 31-08) & telecom law; no specific telemarketing/DNC
MA.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
MA.notes_for_product: Apply conservative approach: consent where feasible; honor opt-out; avoid automated voice without consent.

DZ.regime_b2c_text: General consumer & e-commerce framework; no telemarketing/DNC
DZ.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
DZ.notes_for_product: Use consent where possible; respect call-center licensing; avoid robocalls.

TN.regime_b2c_text: Data-protection law bans processing for advertising without express consent
TN.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
TN.notes_for_product: Treat consumer calls as opt-in; hold proof of consent; offer easy opt-out.

IQ.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
IQ.notes_for_product: Apply conservative defaults (no robocalls; provide opt-out; respect CLI).

IR.callerid_rules: Use registered business lines; no spoofing.
IR.recent_changes: Ongoing 2024–2025 actions to curb advertising calls.
IR.regime_b2c_text: CRA enforcement against promotional voice/SMS from personal numbers; no public DNC
IR.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
IR.notes_for_product: Use registered business lines only; avoid automated/promotional voice without explicit consent; provide opt-out.

IL.regime_b2c_text: Automated calls covered by Spam Law (Amendment 40); live telemarketing constrained by national DNC
IL.regime_b2b_text: Mixed; no specific B2B telemarketing statute; Spam Law still applies to automated systems.
IL.notes_for_product: Block DNC hits; disallow robocalls without prior express consent; open with clear identification; capture consent if recording.

dnc.name: “Do Not Call Me” Registry (מאגר אל תתקשרו אליי)

PS.regime_b2c_text: General consumer/telecom complaint channels; no telemarketing/DNC code
PS.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
PS.notes_for_product: Apply conservative defaults; avoid automated voice; provide opt-out.

YE.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
YE.notes_for_product: Conservative defaults; no robocalls; provide opt-out.

SD.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
SD.notes_for_product: Conservative defaults; no robocalls; provide opt-out.

LY.regime_b2b_text: No specific B2B telemarketing regulation found.
LY.notes_for_product: Conservative defaults; no robocalls; provide opt-out.

TR.recent_changes: IYS regime maintained; 2020 amendments in force.
TR.regime_b2c_text: Commercial electronic messages (incl. calls) require prior consent and IYS registration
TR.regime_b2b_text: B2B to traders/merchants allowed without prior consent but must provide opt-out
TR.notes_for_product: Enforce IYS consent for consumers; allow B2B to traders with immediate opt-out; store proof; avoid robocalls without consent.

countries.confidence: no significant changes recently. electronic communications act and advertising act provisions still apply
but such entities can register on ndd to opt out
no significant changes. electronic privacy act still governs (only natural persons’ communications require consent)
2021 amendment to article 11.7 of the telecommunications act introduced the consumer opt-in requirement and ended the opt-out registry
